name: B. Woeful Permutation
statement:
Effluvium of the MindYou are given a positive integer n.Find any
permutation p of length n such that the sum
operatorname{lcm}(1,p_1) +
operatorname{lcm}(2, p_2) +
ldots +
operatorname{lcm}(n, p_n) is as large as possible. Here
operatorname{lcm}(x, y) denotes the least common multiple (LCM) of
integers x and y.A permutation is an array consisting of n distinct
integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order. For example, [2,3,1,5,4] is a
permutation, but [1,2,2] is not a permutation (2 appears twice in the
array) and [1,3,4] is also not a permutation (n=3 but there is 4 in the
array).
